solution_line_template: William spends {window_wash_time} + {body_wash_time} + {tire_clean_time} + {wax_time} = <<{window_wash_time}+{body_wash_time}+{tire_clean_time}+{wax_time}={normal_car_time}>>{normal_car_time} minutes washing a normal car.

He washed {num_normal_cars} normal cars, so he spent {normal_car_time} * {num_normal_cars} = <<{normal_car_time}*{num_normal_cars}={total_normal_cars_time}>>{total_normal_cars_time} minutes on the normal cars.
He took twice as long as one car for the SUV, so he took {normal_car_time} * {multiplier_for_suv} = <<{normal_car_time}*{multiplier_for_suv}={suv_time}>>{suv_time} minutes on the SUV.
Thus, William spent {total_normal_cars_time} + {suv_time} = <<{total_normal_cars_time}+{suv_time}={total_washing_time}>>{total_washing_time} minutes washing all the vehicles.
